decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and Seasoned Dungeoneer. It also utilizes disruptive elements such as Wasteland, Chalice of the Void, and Void Mirror to control the game. The deck aims to slow down opponents' game plan through disruption and denial of resources, while maintaining a strong board presence to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells (Force of Will, Force of Negation), removal spells (Swords to Plowshares, Prismatic Ending), and disruptive creatures (Lavinia, Azorius Renegade). It also includes card advantage with draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recursion of low-cost permanents, providing additional value and resilience to the control strategy. The deck aims to outlast opponents by efficiently managing resources and disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing mana denial strategies, such as Sphere of Resistance and Null Rod, to slow down opponents while quickly ramping up with Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to bring out powerful artifact creatures like Stonecoil Serpent and Patchwork Automaton. The deck also has ways to recur key cards with Crucible of Worlds and Karn, the Great Creator, along with utility lands like Karakas and Bojuka Bog to disrupt opponents. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with efficient artifacts and disrupting their game plan through resource denial.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by using powerful spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's plans while setting up your own win condition. The deck includes a combination of powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Bolas's Citadel, along with strong counter spells like Mana Drain and Force of Will. The goal is to slow down the opponent's deck while assembling your own key pieces to secure victory. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and tutoring effects to help maintain card advantage and find the right answers at the right time.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Narcomoeba, allowing for explosive plays and recursion of key creatures like Prized Amalgam and Ichorid. Utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to dig through the deck rapidly, and backed up by disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a powerful graveyard-based combo strategy and finish off with cards like Creeping Chill and Hollow One for added damage.

The deck focuses on generating explosive card advantage and mana acceleration through the use of fast mana artifacts and powerful draw spells. It aims to quickly assemble a winning combo using Paradoxical Outcome to bounce back multiple mana rocks and draw into key pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Pyroblast to protect the combo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional resiliency and recursion for key cards in the graveyard.
